modName: Requiem compatibility patch for Mephykuns' More Playable Skeletons
summary: A patch to make skeletons fully compatible with Requiem.
descriptionHtml:
Do you want to play skeletons in Skyrim?  Do you also want to experience the unique frustration of playing Skyrim with Requiem installed?  Well, have we got a mod for you!
<br />
<br />This patch rebalances the custom races from [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59969]More Playable Skeletons[/url] to make them fully compatible with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19281]Requiem - The Roleplaying Overhaul[/url].
<br />
<br />==SUMMARY OF CHANGES==
<br />Corrected all the usual suspects, such as new actor effects/keywords and regen rates.
<br />Modified the skeleton races' skill bonuses and base stats to match their live counterparts, at a -20 penalty to represent the loss of important muscle tissue.  (Skeletons will be challenging to play.  You have been warned.)
<br />
<br />==REQUIRED MODS==
<br />This patch requires both More Playable Skeletons and Requiem.  Fortunately, if you don't have both of them, you don't need this one either.
<br />
<br />==HOW TO IMPLEMENT==
<br />Install via NMM or insert SkelesReborn_Requiem.esp into your Data folder.  Load after Playable Skeletons Reborn.esp and Requiem.esp, somewhere before Requiem for the Indifferent.esp.
author: JBMorgan
